results.title: The Spoken word (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Park, Michael Milan and University of Otago. Dept. of Education and Visual Learning Centre
results.brief_description: Discusses the development of language and its relationship to the developing child. The role of the parent in language development is shown as a high priority and examples are given of adults assisting children towards a more developed form of language in the home and school situations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Park, Michael Milan and University of Otago. Dept. of Education and Visual Learning Centre

results.title: The Spoilers
results.brief_description: Designed as a training film for employees of supermarkets to acquaint them with the dangers of poor sanitation practices. It furnishes fundamental knowledge of basic bacteriology in terms of bacteria, how they multiply and under what conditions, and dramatically points out the dangers microbes hold for human beings.

results.title: The Spirit moves: jazz dance from turn of the century 'til 1950
results.creator_credit: Mura Dehn and Dehn and Matter
results.brief_description: Filmed over 30 years in the director’s dance studio and in the Harlem Savoy Ballroom “The Spirit Moves” is a unique assembly of jazz routines, through the development of the art. From ragtime, struts, cakewalk, through blues, bebop to calypso, mambo and rock and roll. Performed by the artists of the Savioy Ballroom of Harlem and narrated by Mura Dehn. Filmed in black and white with final 15 minute segment in colour.

results.title: The Spider = Earth vs the spider
results.creator_credit: Bert I. Gordon, American International Pictures (AIP) and Santa Rosa Productions
results.brief_description: When her father goes missing Carol and her teenage boyfriend go searching for him. What they find is a giant spider lurking in a nearby cave. Although initially rescued, the town becomes imperilled when the seemingly deceased spider is revived. B-grade director and special effects creator Bert I. Gordon specialised in cheap horror films, usually featuring teenagers in danger from a marauding beast. He does not disappoint here, and although the special effects are fairly outmoded, the film has enduring cult value. Highlights are the Theremin soundtrack and the use of the Carlsbad Caverns National Park in New Mexico, as the spider’s lair.

results.title: The Soviet schoolchild
results.creator_credit: Ministry of Information, Moscow Central News Reel Studios and Soviet War Film Agency
results.brief_description: Soviet education from nursery schools to technical institutes and universities, showing the subjects taught and the methods of teaching at each type of school. The schools shown are situated in many different parts of the USSR.

results.title: The Southern Cloud
results.creator_credit: Cleve Maher and Lions Club of Cooma
results.brief_description: Briefly covers the arrival of Charles Kingsford-Smith and C.T.P. Ulm in Australia after their trans-Pacific flight and the formation of the original Australian National Airways that commenced services in 1931. The Southern Cloud was lost in 1931 until its wreckage was discovered in 1958. Narration by James Dibble.

results.title: The Solar frontier
results.creator_credit: Frances Mellen, Peter Mellen and Mellenco Film Productions
results.brief_description: Architects Nick Nicholson, Greg Allen, and Doug Lorriman and residents discuss the cost, performance and technology of three houses in the Canadian snowbelt which are heated by solar energy.

results.title: The Snails = Les Escargots
results.creator_credit: Societe des Films d'Art et de Culture
results.brief_description: Animated science fiction fantasy about man’s inability to learn from his mistakes. Depicts a peasant who discovers that his tears will make his crops grow, but snails appear, consume the crops and become monstrous creatures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
